titleStmt.title: The Kentish maiden: or, The fumbling ale-draper derided. Who gave a handkerchief and money for a night's lodging with a lass whom at length he left in the lurch. Tune of, The languishing swain. Licensed according to order.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for J. Back, at the Black-box on London Bridge.,

notesStmt.note: Place and date of publication suggested by Wing.
Verse: "I was a modest maid of Kent ..."
Printed on verso: untitled work that begins, "To God alone let us all glory give ..."
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
